Module org.cojen.maker
Package org.cojen.maker

Interface ClassMaker

public interface ClassMaker
Allows new classes and interfaces to be defined dynamically.
See Also:
begin()

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    ClassMaker abstract_()
    Switch this class to be abstract.
    ClassMaker addClass​(String className)
    Add a nested class to this class.
    MethodMaker addClinit()
    Add code to the static initializer of this class.
    default MethodMaker addConstructor​(MethodType type)
    Add a constructor to this class.
    MethodMaker addConstructor​(Object... paramTypes)
    Add a constructor to this class.
    FieldMaker addField​(Object type, String name)
    Add a field to the class.
    MethodMaker addMethod​(Object retType, String name, Object... paramTypes)
    Add a method to this class.
    default MethodMaker addMethod​(String name, MethodType type)
    Add a method to this class.
    ClassMaker another​(String className)
    Begin defining another class with the same loader, domain, and lookup as this one.
    static ClassMaker begin()
    Begin defining a class with an automatically assigned name.
    static ClassMaker begin​(String className)
    Begin defining a class with the given name.
    static ClassMaker begin​(String className, ClassLoader parentLoader, ProtectionDomain domain)
    Begin defining a class with the given name.
    static ClassMaker begin​(String className, MethodHandles.Lookup lookup)
    Begin defining a class with the given name.
    static ClassMaker beginExplicit​(String className)
    Begin defining a class with an explicitly specified name.
    ClassMaker extend​(Object superClass)
    Set an interface or class that this class extends.
    ClassMaker final_()
    Switch this class to be final.
    Class<?> finish()
    Finishes the definition of the new class.
    byte[] finishBytes()
    Finishes the definition of the new class into a byte array.
    MethodHandles.Lookup finishHidden()
    Finishes the definition of a new hidden class, using the lookup passed to the begin method.
    void finishTo​(OutputStream out)
    Finishes the definition of the new class and writes it to a stream.
    ClassMaker implement​(Object iface)
    Add an interface that this class implements.
    ClassMaker interface_()
    Switch this class to be an interface.
    ClassMaker public_()
    Switch this class to be public.
    ClassMaker sourceFile​(String fileName)
    Set the source file of this class file by adding a source file attribute.
    ClassMaker synthetic()
    Indicate that this class is synthetic.

  • Method Details

    • begin

      static ClassMaker begin()
      Begin defining a class with an automatically assigned name.

    • begin

      static ClassMaker begin​(String className)
      Begin defining a class with the given name. The actual name will have a suffix applied to ensure uniqueness.
      Parameters:
      className - fully qualified class name; pass null to automatically assign a name

    • begin

      static ClassMaker begin​(String className, ClassLoader parentLoader, ProtectionDomain domain)
      Begin defining a class with the given name. The actual name will have a suffix applied to ensure uniqueness.
      Parameters:
      className - fully qualified class name; pass null to automatically assign a name
      parentLoader - parent class loader; pass null to use default
      domain - to define class in; pass null to use default

    • begin

      static ClassMaker begin​(String className, MethodHandles.Lookup lookup)
      Begin defining a class with the given name. The actual name will have a suffix applied to ensure uniqueness.
      Parameters:
      className - fully qualified class name; pass null to automatically assign a name
      lookup - finish loading the class using this lookup object

    • beginExplicit

      static ClassMaker beginExplicit​(String className)
      Begin defining a class with an explicitly specified name. All other classes defined from this maker will also be explicit.
      Parameters:
      className - fully qualified class name

    • another

      ClassMaker another​(String className)
      Begin defining another class with the same loader, domain, and lookup as this one. The actual class name will have a suffix applied to ensure uniqueness, unless this maker was created with an explicit name.
      Parameters:
      className - fully qualified class name; pass null to automatically assign a name (unless explicit)
      See Also:
      addClass(java.lang.String)

    • public_

      ClassMaker public_()
      Switch this class to be public. Classes are package-private by default.
      Returns:
      this

    • final_

      ClassMaker final_()
      Switch this class to be final. Classes are non-final by default.
      Returns:
      this

    • interface_

      ClassMaker interface_()
      Switch this class to be an interface. Classes are classes by default.
      Returns:
      this

    • abstract_

      ClassMaker abstract_()
      Switch this class to be abstract. Classes are non-abstract by default.
      Returns:
      this

    • synthetic

      ClassMaker synthetic()
      Indicate that this class is synthetic. Classes are non-synthetic by default.
      Returns:
      this

    • extend

      ClassMaker extend​(Object superClass)
      Set an interface or class that this class extends.
      Parameters:
      superClass - non-null Class or String
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if already assigned

    • implement

      ClassMaker implement​(Object iface)
      Add an interface that this class implements.
      Parameters:
      iface - Class or String
      Returns:
      this

    • addField

      FieldMaker addField​(Object type, String name)
      Add a field to the class.
      Parameters:
      type - a class or name
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if field is already defined

    • addMethod

      MethodMaker addMethod​(Object retType, String name, Object... paramTypes)
      Add a method to this class.
      Parameters:
      retType - a class or name; can be null if method returns void
      paramTypes - classes or names; can be null if method accepts no parameters

    • addMethod

      default MethodMaker addMethod​(String name, MethodType type)
      Add a method to this class.
      Parameters:
      type - defines the return type and parameter types

    • addConstructor

      MethodMaker addConstructor​(Object... paramTypes)
      Add a constructor to this class.
      Parameters:
      paramTypes - classes or names; can be null if constructor accepts no parameters

    • addConstructor

      default MethodMaker addConstructor​(MethodType type)
      Add a constructor to this class.
      Parameters:
      type - defines the parameter types

    • addClinit

      MethodMaker addClinit()
      Add code to the static initializer of this class. Multiple initializers can be added, and they're all stitched together when the class definition is finished. Returning from one initializer only breaks out of the local scope.

    • addClass

      ClassMaker addClass​(String className)
      Add a nested class to this class. The actual class name will have a suitable suffix applied to ensure uniqueness.
      Parameters:
      className - simple class name; pass null to use default
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if not given a simple class name
      See Also:
      another(java.lang.String)

    • sourceFile

      ClassMaker sourceFile​(String fileName)
      Set the source file of this class file by adding a source file attribute.
      Returns:
      this

    • finish

      Class<?> finish()
      Finishes the definition of the new class.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if already finished or if the definition is broken

    • finishHidden

      MethodHandles.Lookup finishHidden()
      Finishes the definition of a new hidden class, using the lookup passed to the begin method. Hidden classes are automatically unloaded when no longer referenced, even if the class loader still is.

      This feature is only fully supported in Java 15. Hidden classes created with earlier versions don't support all the lookup features.

      Returns:
      the lookup for the class; call lookupClass to obtain the actual class
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if already finished, or if the definition is broken, or if no lookup object was passed to the begin method

    • finishBytes

      byte[] finishBytes()
      Finishes the definition of the new class into a byte array.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if already finished or if the definition is broken

    • finishTo

      void finishTo​(OutputStream out) throws IOException
      Finishes the definition of the new class and writes it to a stream.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if already finished or if the definition is broken
      IOException
